headline: Basic Homemade Pasta
description: Making deliciously tender homemade pasta is easy with this three-ingredient recipe. Simply double or triple the amounts if you need more.
name: Basic Homemade Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Combine flour and salt in a medium bowl. Make a well in the center and add beaten egg. Mix well until a stiff dough forms, adding up to 2 tablespoons water if needed.
Knead dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth, 3 to 4 minutes.
Roll dough by hand or with a pasta machine to desired thickness, then cut into strips of desired width and length.

review.reviewBody: I rolled it out by hand - lots of work. Had to make sure it was super thin. Actually, the thinner it was the better it was in the recipe. But it is lots of work. Nice exercise though.
I added cheese sauce on it and it was amazing
I put a couple of tsp of olive oil and 1/4 tsp of garlic powder It came out great.
Added a tablespoon of olive oil. Took about 10 minutes of kneading. Allowed it to rest for 30 minutes before rolling in a pasta machine.
I just substituted regular all purpose flour for gluten-free. It was delicious!
This turned out great, you definitely need to add the water though
There was way too much flour for this recipe and the noodles were flavorless and hard. I do not recommend attempting to make this work for you.

I'm a beginner when it comes to pasta dough but I had no problems with this dough at all. Super simple and easy to work with. For those having difficulty getting the dough to come together, patience is key. Keep working it with your hands, add a little water if it's too dry, add a little flour if it's too wet. Keep working at it, homemade is so worth it and rewarding.
Tasted wrong I don’t know how probably something I did
This pasta dough was easy and really nice to work with was a bit dry but once I put it through the kead attachment a few times one number1 smoothed it right out.Very happy with this recipie
Great recipe! You should always allow the dough to rest after kneading it before working with it. This recipe can be made beforehand and kept wrapped in the fridge for days ready to go.

So easy! I made with it whole wheat flour and made ravioli and used the “scraps” for pasta. Like some others, I added a tbsp of olive oil instead of 2 tbsp of water. Also, using whole wheat, I had to add a little extra water as I was kneading for the right consistency.

I made this today. I don't have a pasta machine or a dough hook etc. I made the recipe as stated. I used a bowl, a rolling pin, and a sharp knife. I didn't read enough of the reviews to realize that in order to actually have a dough that can be worked with I would have had to add more than 2 tbsp of water, or even oil, and rest the dough in plastic wrap for 30 minutes or so. My dough was very crumbly and dry, and it took alot of effort to knead the dough into a workable ball or roll. I also didn't realize it would be nearly impossible to hand roll the dough thin enough so that the fettuccine noodles would cook up properly. Instead I ended up with very tasty noodles that were too thick, large and chewy, and not what I was expecting. I like the recipe. I will try again. If I could afford a pasta machine I'd like to pick one up, maybe at some point in the near future. But for now I just want a nice pliable dough that I can work with and figure out a way to roll ot thin enough so that it's eatable. It wasn't a fun, enjoyable experience lol. It was discouraging. However, I remain hopeful. I am anxious to experiment more with this recipe employing some of the tips mentioned in the reviews.

Very good starter recipe, but I took off a star as it needed more water, and I followed the advice of others and swapped out 1 tbsp of water for oil. Let it rest for awhile, and it rolled out perfectly.

I've never made pasta from scratch before, so it's possible there's a learning curve, but I would've liked some more info, because I had a heck of a time getting the dough to flatten out. It was very hard to cut, too. I had to add a lot of extra water to get the dough to stick together.
I added a little Olive oil . Best pasta we have ever had.
Followed exactly and came out perfect for my first pasta. I used the dough for ravioli. I also made a second batch and puréed roasted peppers and halved the egg and added to flour.
Quick, easy and beginner friendly, it was my first time making noodles and it came out great!

First time ever making my own pasta. It was faaaaaantastic! The whole family loved it for supper. My wife, who had a toothache, simply couldn't resist. 

And Amy C.'s suggestion made it an extra success. Thank you
Easy to make. Good tasting.

I used this recipe to make ravioli. The kid and I LOVED it, so I'm counting it as a success. 

I'm actually making noodles for pasta tonight, using this same recipe.

This was an okay recipe. I’ve never made pasta by hand before so maybe I didn’t do it exactly right. The noodles tasted pretty bland and while I liked it alright, my wife said she prefers the ones that come out of a box.

Pretty Easy and pretty good for my first pasta but, as other reviews have said, not quite right. I always read several reviews so I was prepared. Added 1tsp olive oil (per batch) and several tablespoons of water to have a proper springy ball of dough, and rested it for 30 min Wrapped in cling film before rolling it out. Just wish I had a pasta sheeter because hand rolling it was hard and I didn’t get it as thin as I wanted. 

I served it with a garlic butter sauce, bacon, Parmesan, and broccoli.
We don't have a pasta machine so did by hand. It was awesome. Pretty easy. I'm easily intimidated with foods I've never made, but this was fun
Added 1 tablespoon of olive oil instead of water and let it rest before rolling out. PERFECT AND EASY.
I added one egg yolk to each egg, super easy super tasty!

My first try at noodles. I was thrilled with the results! I’ve been wanting to make noodles for years, even bought a cutter for kitchen aid mixer. 

No tools needed to cut the pasta, besides a knife. 

Making another batch right now.

This is a really good recipe, but I made it a little too thick so it would probably be better thinner. I used all purpose flour and next time I make this I might try I different flour. But I really recommend this to pasta lovers!!! ??????
It was sooooooooooooooo good!????
I didn’t have the fanciest rack for the pasta and use a cookie rack instead , bit it work out fine. The recipe is easy to duplicate. #Nailedit. I think?

This was my first time making noodles at home, so I chose this recipe for its simplicity. I doubled it, but other than that I made no alterations. 
After mixing, I did let the dough rest for 30 minutes prior to rolling it out. I don’t know if it helped, but I saw it strongly suggested in previous reviews. 
This dough was quite hard and hard to roll and stretch. I did the best I could but the end result was definitely thicker than a noodle should be. 
In the future I may add some oil as has been previously suggested to see if it becomes easier to work with.
No complaints about the flavour however, but it could benefit from some experimenting as well. 
Great recipe to start with.

It was easy to make but I let it rest for 1 hour before rolling it out and cutting it into strips. The resting makes the flour release gluten and makes it stretchy and chewy. I will definitely make this again!!
This was a wonderfully easy recipe that made delicious pasta. So much better than store bought. I doubled the recipe and used 2 tablespoons olive oil and 2 tablespoon waters. Super!
Boyfriend loved it!
This pasta tasted great, but when it says “6 servings” it means 6 small servings.

I made this as explained.
I loved this recipe, simple and quick to make. 
Thank you, I'll continue to make noodles from scratch, this was easy easy.

Super easy, doubled the recipe, I added 2 tbsp olive oil and it was enough to just bring the dough together. I let it rest after kneading for a couple hours, rolled out and cut without any issue! Great simple recipe, I’ve modified it by adding dried basil and other herbs for great flavor!
Simple & to the point. Lacked in the instruction department.
Perfect.
Perfect pasta!...I lost my italian grandmas recipe and used this one and it was just like hers!...Thank you for the memories!....And the recipe of course :D
It was okay the dough was a bit hard to work with and overall flavourless but its good for beginners.
I made this into ravioli and I found that dipping my fingers in water to seal the ravioli worked really well
This was wonderful made it again the next day with leftover spaghetti sauce
Love it. It’s my go to recipe for fettuccini, spaghetti, and ravioli.

This is my second attempt at making homemade pasta. My first attempt was a total disaster. So bad, that it's been a full year before I decided that I should try again. 

This recipe is VERY simple. I don't have a pasta maker so I rolled it out with a wooden roller. I made them WAY to thick but the flavor was excellent. 

To cook this recipe, I added the fresh pasta to a boiling pot of lightly salted water. Within 3 minutes they were ready to be eaten. DELISH!
This was my very first attempt at making pasta. It turned out perfectly! Thank you so much for sharing.

I don’t know what parallel world has this recipe making 3 servings. I doubled it and it wasn’t enough for me, my wife, and my 8 & 6 year old sons. Otherwise it seems fine; first homemade pasta experience
Simple and easy and worked out great!
I doubled it. It wasn’t half enough for my boys!! 4 eggs next time.

I just made this recipe today and I ended up having to add about 4 tablespoons of water to get it completely mixed and instead of salt I used seasoning salt, after wrapping it in plastic wrap I left it in the fridge for about an hour and a half to firm up a bit. I still have some left over, to make some more tomorrow I ended up only turning about 1/4 of it into pasta today.

four others keep in mind your altitude can affect things with flour in it when it comes to either making cake pies or pasta.

LET IT REST!
It was awesome, I just substituted 1 sp. of water by oil, added more eggs (5 eggs for each 4 cups of flour) & let it rest for at least 30min.
easy to make, flavorful.
I did it!! First time making homemade noodles. I did like all the others and added 1 tsp of olive oil and let the dough rest. Easy and yummy.

This is a good fundamental recipe to build on with personal preferences and modifications. I made pasta sheets and stuffed, rolled, and cut the into cannelloni al forno (oven baked). I doubled the batch and used 2 tablespoons of EVOO and more water to balance the moisture, and facilitate the compression of the dough. Resting the dough wrapped in plastic is essential, and having the cooked and mixed stuffing made before you fill the pasta sheets is also essential. I blanched the pasta sheets in salted boiling water for 90 seconds, then shocked them in ice water, and patted them dry before stuffing and cutting them. I used commercial General Mills “Sperry” Extra Fancy Durum flour number 57602.

My first attempt at making pasta and the family and I LOVE it. I read and followed others suggestions. Thank you all for the helpful hints. Less salt, olive oil and let it rest. I bought semolina flour months ago so I could make pasta. I used half and half, plain flour and semolina. The recipe and directions are simple and easy. I made ravioli stuffed with Italian sausage and cheeses. So good. I don’t have a pasta machine but I will soon. Using my rolling pin the first time I didn’t get the pasta rolled thin enough and my ravioli were a bit thick and chewy. I rolled them really thin (pasta swells as cooks) next batch and they were perfect. This will be my go to recipe. Most every time I google a recipe, an All Recipes, recipe is one of the top ones and they are always good.

Doubled this recipe and still found it was too dry. I added in some olive oil and an extra egg and it was perfect. Only let it sit for about 10 minutes and it went through the pasta machine really easily!

Will definitely be making again.
I just made this recipe. Its better then the others i have tried. The recipie was easy to make. the taste was excellent. I will use this recipe again

I added 1/2 cup of homemade basil & spinach pesto, which led to adding about 1/2c. more flour. It was fantastic! Served it with Pesto, grilled chicken and garden fresh cherry tomatoes, covered with fresh grated Parm. It was a smash!

I started which a few batches all made different ways. I was surprised on how they all came out great! This recipe is my go-to if I'm low on cash and want a nice easy meal for me or my family. Simple ingredients, multitude of ideas and fashions. I would really recommend just spending a while to get to know the dough. It's easy to start and maintain. As an inexperienced pasta maker, this is my Go-To.
Turned out perfect. I have a pasta press and cutter. So easy!
added 1 tbsp olive oil, cooked for 2-3 min in boiling water.

I used my Kitchenaid Mixer dough attachment. I left out the salt and it was fine. This recipe makes the perfect amount for two people and we had some leftover. I'm going to make it again tonight for homemade ravioli.
This was great! Makes fantastic fettuccine alfredo. Has the same flavor as my favorite box pasta without the hassle of cooking it long enough to make sure the pasta isn't crunchy.
Doubled the recipe- ended up w two tbsp olive oil and 6 tbsp water- perfect
My whole family really liked this recipe. Next time I will try to make some adjustments like making gourmet spinach pasta or mushroom pasta.

I tried a different recipe last week and thought I wouldn't try again because it was so eggy and chewy. I tried this one today and it was super easy and delicious. I used half olive oil and half water and did have to add just a little more water to it. i boiled the pasta for about 8 minutes. I melted 1 TBL of butter and squeeze a little garlic paste in the butter. Added a bag of steamed broccoli florets and the pasta. I added a little of the pasta broth and added fresh ground pepper to the top. It was a delicious meal for 1. For me this recipe makes 2 servings.
Easy and just the right amount for 2 adults.

Not sure what I did, but made this exactly as written. I got a bunch of crumbly flour that was nowhere near a dough. I added some olive oil, still crumbly, then a tbsp of water, still crumbly. I added a bit more water but was concerned I was going to end up with leaden noodles but nothing I was doing was coming near a dough. I finally doused it with some water knowing I was probably already giving up. Then I had glue, so I threw the wad in the trash. I'm not used to failing in the kitchen, so I'm sort of at a loss on this one.

Thank you so very much! My mother loved them. It's not easy caring for an aging parent and this recipe made the job easier.

Much love,

Ashanti
We made this one night on a whim. It’s dangerous how easy and delicious this is - we may make pasta all the time now!
My first attempt at homemade pasta. Like others I substituted olive oil for water and doubled the recipe. Turned out great!
Easy and tastes amazing
It was great!!
Use 2 eggs or it will be a pain to roll out

Delicious! I followed the advice of some other reviewers and doubled the recipe and added a tiny bit of olive oil to the flour, egg, salt & water mixture during kneading. I also let the dough rest for 45 minutes before rolling out by hand and it truly made it easy to work with. Awesome recipe! ??
Wanted to try making pasta after watching Master of None lol. This is pretty easy to make and actually tasted better than expected for the first try.
This one's a keeper. Easy to make, easy to adjust for dryness, easy to calculate larger batches. Would have liked a more assertive taste but it IS only white flour and one egg.
instead of 1 to 2 tbsp of water... i used olive oil....turned out amazing!
Make sure your dough is quite dry (use a lot of flour) before cutting. If it is too moist, the strands will stick together.
Being a single, I halved the recipe (and still have lots extra for leftovers!). I am a good cook, but have never been able to master making pasta...until I fell upon this recipe. Fantastic results.

Very easy recipe I made it exactly the way the recipe suggested. I have a pasta machine so rolling it out and then cutting it into spaghetti strips was very easy. I did not let the dough sit at all. I did however hang the strips of spaghetti on a wood pasta dryer for about 15 minutes. I boiled it one minute, turned off the burner and let the pasta sit in the water for another 30seconds. The quantity was perfect for my husband and I.
I will definitely be making this again !
Oh and I won't be buying spaghetti any time soon!!
I made the recipe as written and it was wonderful. Good flavour and I didn’t find it dry at all.
Wonderful, flavorful scratch pasta! Everyone who has tried it has loved it!!!!
I made this with gluten free flour and it was delicious. I had to add a little more water and a little bit of olive oil to get the right consistency but it was still fast and easy.

This is the first time I’ve made pasta and it turned out fantastic! I did add the 2 tablespoons of water. Although it seemed very crumbly it came together nicely with kneading. Because it was crumbly to start I kneaded it in the bowl I mixed it in just in case it needed more liquid. I let the dough rest in the fridge for about a half hour before rolling it out.
made some great pasta. I ended up adding a little more water, but not sure if my Semolina flower just took a bit more or what.
I always double this recipe.
Made it per instructions and came out wonderful!! Once I get a pasta roller, it'll be even better! I may not buy pasta ever again!
Totally easy and amazing!
This was awesome!! I’m a rookie pasta maker and this was very easy to follow along...I added 1/4 teaspoon of olive oil as well...good good stuff!!

I used this recipe to make pasta for my very first time. This was a very easy and simple recipe to follow. I used my bread machin to make the dough and kneed it so I used maybe another tablespoon of water and maybe next time I will use oil instead of that extra water. No changes to the recipe besides extra water, the flavor is mild and tastes way better than store bought pasta.
Crazy easy, and everything you want in a homemade pasta. deliciousness and simplicity and on point!

Perhaps this is a US recipe, but “1 Cup” of flour translates to the metric system as being 340g. I tried this recipe based on those proportions (1 egg to 340g flour) and it didn’t work at all. The dough was far too stiff. After further research I used a recipe based on a ratio of 100g flour per egg (plus a healthy pinch of salt and a glug of olive oil) - a two egg recipe feeds 4 - which was a great success. Although, I might have got the measurement translation completely wrong!

This is a very good recipe for pasta, easy to make and easy to double (or more) if needed and taste Awesome!
Thanks for posting it.

It was fun to make and I made a filling for some of them. I did this because I made raviolis for a few of them for fun. It was basic ricotta filling with minced garlic and olive oil. I hope this helps anyone who makes this! ~BakingQueen
I am new to cooking and wow this was easy, I followed the receipts andused a wine bottle to roll the pasta. I have made this again and used some leftover chicken stock in the waster.

This is a wonderful basic pasta recipe! As others mentioned, I substituted a tablespoon of water with olive oil. I also let the dough rest for 15 minutes before I started rolling. It turned out perfect!
Basic, and easy. Quick, durable pasta if it’s a bit dry wash your hands and knead. don’t dry your hands though... (:
Great and quick pasta.. easy and tastes great
